page.title: 01Glithno - N of Stonehaven
page.content: An elevated landscape to the north of Stonehaven and rather exposed to easterly winds from the neraby coast. The land slopes up to the NW corner culminating in Curlethney Hill at 246m. The higher land to the W and NW is moorland an includes the roman camp of Raedykes with its bank and ditch systems. This high ground gives birth to 2 streams, the Burn of Muchalls draining to the E and the Burn of Monboys flowing southwards through a glacial meltwater channel. With lessening altitude the land changes to rough grazing in squares 5 & 9 but to an extensive wetland moss in square 7, in which are peat diggings. Lower still are to be found many small farms and crofts with enclosed fields used for hay and silage. A council refuse tip in square 7 pollutes a small stream draining to the moss.
